intro: Gymnandra pallasii, commonly known as the Pallas's gymnostachium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Gymnandra pallasii is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
